document.masterDocTitle: New taxa and records of Gryllacrididae (Orthoptera, Stenopelmatoidea) from South East Asia and New Guinea with a key to the genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New taxa and records of Gryllacrididae (Orthoptera, Stenopelmatoidea) from South East Asia and New Guinea with a key to the genera

bibRefCitation.author: Liu
bibRefCitation.refString: Liu X. W. (2007) A new genus of the subfamily Gryllacrinae from China (Orthoptera: Stenopelmatidae: Gryllacridae). Scientific Research Monthly, 6, 1 - 2.

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 68. Genus Homogryllacris: A–G, H. armigera sp. nov. female (A–D) and male holotype (E–G); H–J, H. stabilis sp. nov. male holotype.—Habitus dorsal view (A, E, H), face (B, F, I), stridulatory pegs on second and third abdominal tergites, front is right (C, G, J), ovipositor (D). Scales 10 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 69. Genus Homogryllacris: A–C, H. armigera sp. nov. holotype (A–B) and paratype (C); D–F, H. stabilis sp. nov. holotype; G–I, H. armigera sp. nov. female.—Male abdominal apex in lateral (A), apical (B, F), ventral (C, E), and dorsal view (D), female end of abdomen with seventh sternite, subgenital plate and base of ovipositor (G in ventral, H in anterior view), end of left hind tibia in dorsal view (I).
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 70. A–C, Homogryllacris artinii (Griffini, 1913) male (A–B) and female (C); D–G, Homogryllacris buyssoniana (Griffini, 1912) male; H–J, Homogryllacris kurseonga (Griffini, 1913) male (H–I) and female (J); K–M, Homogryllacris? maindroni (Griffini, 1913) male; N–P, Niphetogryllacris succinea (Bolivar, 1900) male.—Male abdominal apex in apical (A, F, I, M), ventral (B, E, L, O), dorsal (D, N), and lateral view (G–H, K); female subgenital plate (C, J); male subgenital plate (P). Abbreviations: 9th ninth abdominal tergite; ce cercus; pr projection of tenth tergite; sg subgenital plate; st stylus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Homogryllacris gladiata Liu
Xian-wei, 2007

Diagnosis. Small to medium sized species. Ocelli small or indistinct; fastigium verticis wider than scape, nearly rounded, frons smooth. Tegmina and hind wings developed or absent. Second and third abdominal tergites with transverse stridulatory teeth on lateral margins. Wings hyaline. Fore and middle tibiae with 4 pairs of movable long spines and a pair of short apical spurs on ventral margins. Male ninth abdominal tergite without process; tenth abdominal tergite narrow, with a pair of processes that are often long and sclerotised with membranous base. Ovipositor usually longer than hind femur, almost straight.

I also include in this genus four of the species formerly included in
Brachyntheisogryllacris
that have the male eighth abdominal tergite without apical projection, the ninth tergite undivided, entire, and the tenth abdominal tergite provided with a pair of long, dorso-ventrally compressed projections that distinctly project behind the tip of abdomen and terminate into an acute tip.
